Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Adelemp
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny - but very sweet only shower breakfast could be better but wonderful staff and clean - great value for rome

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Romantic Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BJ_INT
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel near to Roma Termini (10-15 min walk). The pictures on the hotel`s cite are real - everything is just like this. Our room was little but very charming with lovely little balcony surrounded by flowers (you can see on my picture). In the bathroom there is a bath tube,very good water pressure, bathroom kit. The room is quiet and sunny with very nice fan, that gives an impression of old romantic italian movie. There is a vintage lift - the hotel is situated on the 3th floor of an old, but clean and nice building. From Roma Termini you can catch the both lines of the Metro as well a lots of buses. Near to the hotel there is a bus stop too. Nomber 60 Express is the best way to reach the center in 10 minutes. The bus runs in every 5 min.

Reviews.Title: “A great find for the price”
Reviews.Author: npapehn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our last three nights in Italy at this hotel. Only hotel we stayed at that had a working elevator. The rooms were extremely small, but clean enough with comfortable beds. The staff was helpful and hospitable, and even gave us a bottle of wine to celebrate our honeymoon. The brekfast was average, but more than sufficed for a good start to the day. The hotel decor was very nice and our m came with a balcony. I will say that the location is bit off, as it is not very close to the tourist attractions - metro is not too far though. It was the least expensive place that we stayed during our two week trip, and it exceeded our expectations. Definetly worth the price. If you are just looking for a nice, clean place to for a home base to explore Rome from, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happytotravel10
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Lilium. The staff Julia was soo nice, she went all the way to help with extending our stay and is just such a sweetheart. The rooms were wonderfully cosy and comfy. Julia upgraded us to a room with the covered balcony and even hubby loved it! We felt that it gave a difference to all the hotels we have been staying in. The shower was great and everything was well kept and cleaned. The lady at the breakfast room (we didn't get her name as she did not speak english at all) she deserves a thumbs up for the great coffee and breakfast she prepared everyday! I know that she feels passionately for her job as we can just taste it in the food and drink. Great job! The room was a little small, but we still loved it anyway. We even loved the antique lift! Julia and team at Lilium Hotel, please keep up the fantastic work you guys have doing! We hope to see you guys soon!!! Ciao!! p/s TIP:There's no signage, but if you get a group taxi from the airport it cost about E14 per pax (train is E15 per pax), they will drop you right at the doorstep (bring the address!!)

Reviews.Title: “Classy & Cosy”
Reviews.Author: goanton
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for our honeymoon, 1 year ago, and were impressed by the kindness of the owners and the classy, neat style of the hotel. When the owners found out we were on our honeymoon, they offered us a bottle of champagne and snacks, which we found to be very polite. The breakfast room is especially cute, with a small coffee bar and a self service breakfast. The breakfast is quite above average of what you can find in similar priced hotels. While the others usually serve some store bought cake and espresso, Lilium served an elegant small spread of delicious food. The hotel in on the 3rd floor of an old Roman building and has a lovely lobby where you can relax, and use their complimentary wi-fi. Rooms are on the small side, but some have a cute little balcony with flowers. We will definitely go back and suggest it to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place, but with some problems”
Reviews.Author: OffWeGo2010
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel and clean, with good air conditioning and good beds. Charming decor. Problems: * Breakfast lady seemed nice but didn't speak one word of English. Not one word (I find that surprising in a hotel used mainly by foreigners). The breakfast food was just okay, no concept of Cafe Americano. * The elevator can only be accessed after climbing many stairs (with your suitcases when you show up). * The location is close to the train station but not that close -- we walked from the train and found it hard because the sidewalks were in terrible condition and I couldn't roll the suitcase most of the way. The taxi drivers wouldn't drive us to the hotel because they said it was too close. But yet it's pretty far (maybe a third of a mile or so) and the streets aren't well marked there. * Also on location, we love to walk and did walk several times to the main area where there are things you'd want to see (fountains, Forum, plazas), but it was a long walk (maybe two miles). There are many hotels located much closer. * The internet connection is cumbersome and unreliable. You need not only a password, but to log into some proxy server -- the result is that I only had internet for five minutes of a three day stay. * The television is entirely in Italian, no English channels, and late night there are inappropriate shows on, unblocked.

Reviews.Title: “dont miss this gem - recommended”
Reviews.Author: Larry-Pattie
Reviews.Content: son traveled from US to Rome to visit girlfriend studying in Florence. she trained down to meet him to spend weekend in Rome. Booked this hotel for them, sight unseen. Turned out to be excellent choice - quaint, clean and even tho young students, were treated with respect and lots of assistance (as two young americans not knowing their way around). in the euro tradition, great breakfast included...reasonable rates - walking distance to train station and city bus loops. excellent find!

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: rastus6
Reviews.Content: Not much to say really, great hotel. So cute and colourful. I really loved it and the staff were so friendly. Breakfast was good, coffee was good, we had a cute little balcony. Easy to get to tourist attractions by bus or a walk if you prefer. Wifi is free, air conditioning is great. They also had a deal going where we got a free private car from the airport to the hotel which I thought was great. If you're ever in Rome, do yourself a favour and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome people, amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WildBirds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lilium while visiting Rome in July 2011. One time they were able to find us a last minute 3-nights availability which was greatly appreciated. The location is great (in the quiet financial district but no more than 20 min walk to Spanish Steps or Fontana di Trevi; 10 min from Termini or Repubblica Metro Station). Lots of bus stops are right downstairs, ready to take you all across Rome. This hotel is amazing: sparkling clean, cozy, quiet and the service is really great. Breakfast is very good and so is the coffee. While we stayed at the hotel in three separate occasions, we’ve had the Forget-Me-Not room for 8 nights, which is a wonderful quiet room, with a flower-filled balcony facing an interior courtyard. We also stayed in two other rooms, (Tiger Lilies being one of them) facing the street. Both rooms have a small wrought iron balcony. All rooms are cleaned daily and have AC, fan, TV and a mini-fridge stocked with drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) and sweets. One thing worth mentioning is that they were able to find us a last minute 3-nights availability which was greatly appreciated. We cannot say enough about this wonderful little hotel and especially about all the people working here. Francesco, Giulia, Federico, Silvia, Ivanna, Elena, Tony, Ionela : you guys are AWESOME and you made our stay absolutely unforgettable! Mille grazie e a presto! Alex, Anca & Sebastian

Reviews.Title: “From second to first choice in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: verolebel
Reviews.Content: The hotel I wanted to book was full so I tried Lilium Hotel in the same neighborhood. What a nice surprise! The rooms are clean, quiet and nicely decorated. The staff at the reception is friendly and always available to give indications. A small elevator can be used if you have heavy suitcases. There is a big window in the "breakfast room" so you can sip your cappuccino and admire Rome's blue sky at the same time! The location is also super convenient: right in front of the hotel many buses go to downtown, Termini station and Trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: 1beebee
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were really friendly and helpful. We couldn't fault the service, either from the desk or in the breakfast room. We ordered champagne and snacks on arrival - pricey, perhaps, at 50 euros, but what a treat. We spent our first afternoon on a sunny balcony drinking Mumms and nibbling pistachios, parmesan and dried cranberries, all carefully prepared by the receptionist. With honey. Excellent. Finally we dragged ourselves away and went to the Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain, both about 20 minutes' (at most) walk away. The hotel was in a good position, 10 minutes' walk from the Termini station, on a bus route, ten minutes or less from Republica and within ten minutes of Via Veneto and Villa Borghese park. It's on the third floor of a building and not well signed but if you've mapped it beforehand you know where to look and find it quite easily. A quaint old-fashioned lift - metal doors, two sets to open and close - takes you up the three floors and is definitely necessary if you're carrying luggage. The reception is airy and pretty. Our room was a superior room, hence the flower-filled balcony looking out onto a quieter back street. It had air-conditioning (which we didn't need) and a ceiling fan, which we definitely needed. In our superior room we had a bath as well as a shower, but not all rooms had that There was also a safe in the room, hairdryer and excellent minibar, very reasonably priced e.g. 4 euros for a mini bottle of Prosecco. Ordinary wine and beer was less. Water was one euro, which is nice if you want it chilled, and cheaper than from the outdoor food stalls, but the tap water was fine too and tasted great. . We topped up our bottles daily, or from fountains around the city. Breakfast were served from 7 to 10 and were excellent - continental but as much as you wanted - rolls, croissants, choice of coffees or teas, fresh juice if you asked for oranges to be squeezed and also pineapple juice chilled from the carton. Cheeses, meats, yogurts, cereals ... We had agreat start to every day. Another nice touch - you were able to use the hotel laptop for free, for an hour, daily, which we made use of twice in our 5 day break. Liked best - the balcony, breakfast, service, pretty decor Liked least - room was small, only a queen bed, no English TV channels so we were without news, no wireless in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lilium - a flower in Rome”
Reviews.Author: anavg
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my mum in twin room with small balcony. We had all 4 nights of good sleep there, was nice and warm though could hear lady with heels every morning - God bless early morning shifts! Had best croissants ever - with vanilla filling - must have. Breakfast was nice and simple, very good for Italian breakfast. Coffee machine still makes amazing cappuccino! Staff was very welcoming and efficient! Lost of good advice. Nice bathroom with plenty of warm towels and bath soaps, etc... Room was cleaned every day despite the fact there was no request for it :) No problems checking in or out, neither finding the place. All in all a PLEASANT place to stay while in Rome <3

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natusiar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Lilium for 6 nights. It exeeded my expectations a lot! Very good location, just short walk from Barberini, Spanish Steps, Republica, Termini, Via Veneto. It is on the third floor of residentional building. The only problem is to see the small sign of the hotel at the entrance to the building to give a ring when you come first in the dark time.Felt very safe in that area of Rome. Bus stops are right on the corner and in front of the hotel. Staff is exeptionally helpful and welcoming! Althogh booked single room i was offered a doble with no extra payment. Design of the rooms is cosy and warm. Room is very very clean and has heating and hot water 24 hours. No english channels. Brekfast is enough, croissans are even more tasty then in Paris! Would prefer stay there again next time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “I could hear the guy next door yawning”
Reviews.Author: jolielaide
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming. Not easy to find, as others have pointed out, but if you have the address and look for the name of the hotel on the door of the building (think: visitng a friend in Rome), it's not an issue. I took the long way from Termini on foot (you want to head for Via Goito straight out of the station) so it was a bit of a trek with bags. The rooms are typical for the region, I think: sparse, clean, a little dark. Mine (Bluebells) was tiny. The room itself was quiet - facing a shaftway, so definitely no ambience; the problem was the thin walls. I could not only hear people as they walked down the hall and opened and closed their rooms, but every hallway conversation, not to mention the loud yawner next door, was like I was right there with them. So if your neighbours are considerate, you're in luck but if you happen to visit the same time as a drunken group of party-hounds, you're probably in for a long night. The location is OK. I found it convenient for proximity to Termini, and if you enjoy walking you can stroll around, but will probably have to take a cab at night, it's a bit of a hike at the end of a long day. The value for money is good, it's a secure, friendly, cute little place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, friendly, great location, good value for a Rome visit!”
Reviews.Author: JJones458
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I visited Rome on her College spring break and stayed at the Lilium hotel for 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay. Very clean and friendly staff, nice breakfast was included and very nice. Not a luxury hotel but very adequate and nicely decorated. Close to the Termini and easy walking distance to the arttractions. About 3-4 blocks to a subway station. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for our weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: eezamcgrookes
Reviews.Content: For our budget, I don't think we could have found a better hotel if we'd searched for a month. The rooms were cute, comfortable and clean with the small terrace being a lovely touch. Service was attentive yet subtle. Location was close to perfect; 15 minutes walk from the nearest of the 'big sites' but by being out of the centre we were closer to the good restaurants where the locals actually eat i.e. away from the over-priced touristy areas. If you are going to Rome for a weekend and are not planning on spending a fortune on a 5 star hotel, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, location could have been better”
Reviews.Author: yym-sf
Reviews.Content: First off, I made a reservation with the wrong date. I had a complicated reservation because I had a complicated itinerary. I wrote a date wrongly in my reservation email (which is BTW the best way to make a resi because they respond speedily) They emailed me on the date I was supposed to arrive and informed me that they would have to charge a day's rate because I did not show up. I panicked and gave them a call, explaining that I had made a mistake. In his sweet Italian accent, he assured that it was OK and that he would arrange for my arrival date to be corrected. The hotel occupies a floor of a nondescript building which can be hard to find since there are no big signs on the streets. I used Google map to get an idea of what it looked like from the street, therefore had no problems finding the place. The only issue we had was the location which required us to take a bus into the tourist attractions of the city. Other than that, we thoroughly enjoyed staying our stay here with the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for a romantic holiday”
Reviews.Author: soap88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend last year and it was the perfect hotel for us. We are a young couple and the hotel fit perfectly within our budget, plus it was conveniently located. We walked EVERYWHERE. The hotel is only about 10 minutes walk from Termini station, and all the sites such as the Colosseum, Spanish steps, Campo di Fiori etc are within a comfortable walking distance. We did walk to the Vatican as well, although if you do choose to take the metro it is very easy to get to from Termini. The hotel is small so the service was very personal, and it was the perfect quiet atmosphere for our little romantic getaway. The rooms are simple although beautifully decorated with a modern bathroom complete with a bathtub that we often made use of! Breakfast was simple and it was possible to get freshly made espresso drinks that were included with the complimentary breakfast. Memorable holiday, lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little gem”
Reviews.Author: andrewandbethan
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews, this is a delightful little hotel. We didn't have a problem finding it - although the name is not in flashing neon outside the house number is clearly marked. The flower themed rooms are very pleasant and well refurbished although the shower didn't exactly blow me away. The rooms were quiet enough for our liking. The breakfast was generous and included superb Italian coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice. The location is ok, about 10 - 15 minute walk to the station and not far from the nearest Metro, while the buses just outside can get you to the town centre in a few minutes (tickets available from reception). The best feature is the staff, who are all charming and friendly to a fault and very helpful. We were lucky to be staying during the 20th September celebrations (the hotel is on 20th September street) and were treated to a spectacular veterans parade from the balcony. All in all this hotel is very good value and suitable for all age groups, but if you are a very fussy traveller then bear in mind the lift starts at the first floor (they will help with luggage if you ask) and the free internet WiFi connection is hit and miss.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: european101
Reviews.Content: Typical small European rooms, but clean and bright. Continental breakfast included in nice bright room. We had some difficulty finding the hotel, but when we arrived around 9:30am from an early flight, the room was not available, but they welcomed us and sat us down with cups of coffee so that we could relax a little while they tried to get a room ready. room overlooked back which was a quiet street. Location quite a long way from the main tourist areas. Small problem in having to lug suitcases up a small flight of stairs to the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: pcguy74
Reviews.Content: We were here at the middle of August. We had looked at reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. This hotel is SPOTLESS and quite. It is a little off the beaten path but as others have said, mostly a 15 minute walk to all the "action" of Rome and about a 10 minute walk from the train station. The bus stop is right outside but we never took it as we enjoy walking. Coming back in the evenings though we always wanted to take the lift/elevator to the 3rd floor. Our room had enough space for the two of us, ample closet space and a very nice bathroom and shower. The little terrace was a nice touch but we didn't even use it other than when we first arrived. The breakfast is great, with yogurt, meats and cheeses, fruit juice and coffee with pastries. I found it enough to satisfy even an "American sized" breakfast appetite. I like my breakfast to get a good start to the day and don't care so much about the other meals so this was my favorite "feature" of the hotel! The staff was very friendly and helped us get a taxi to the airport so we didn't have to get up early enough to take the train and so we could have Breakfast again :) We WILL stay here again if in Rome. I do hope they fix their crazy Internet connection as my wife had trouble connecting and I work in IT and found it confusing. The connection works, but not efficiently. Regardless, we'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Rome experience with inspiration.”
Reviews.Author: ErnaDaalman
Reviews.Content: The Lilium Hotel, a hotel with inspiration, an oasis, artistic and pure. The Lilium Hotel is like coming home after a day filled with antique, historical panorama's. The breakfastroom is filled with the morning sun and delightfull croissants. The evening restaurants with Rome's speciality's: ossobucco, veal or fish are only a block away!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hidden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raneen
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent , the breakfast room was adorable, the rooms are antique style, bathrooms are beautiful , little golf ball soaps and shampoos were very cute, the rate was perfect for the location, and i loved the flooring and decor. The bed was not the most comfortable, the entrance is confusing from the street (the hotel is on the 3rd floor of an apt. building) loved our stay

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and cute ambiance”
Reviews.Author: attytude22
Reviews.Content: Lilium Hotel came as a recommendation to us from family friends. We had a very large bed and roomy bathroom but there wasn't much room to move around the bed. Our room was quiet and worth asking for a quiet room. The hotel is a great location to the train station/metro/bus stops but is a longer walk to some of the popular sights. We felt like we did TON of walking. The bedding was not the nicest but not bad! The staff was helpful and someone was always on duty to let you in and answer any questions we had. They also gave us a bottle of champagne for our anniversary. I don't know that I would stay here again for the amount of money we paid but we had a nice breakfast every morning and had some nice meals close by.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: MarthaBoston
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Lilium and what a gem. It is a charming hotel, with a lovely staff, in a great location. Upon check -in, they upgarded me from the single room I booked to a double that they had available. The hotel is a little tricky to find. There is no sign and it is located on the 4th(?) floor of a building, but once you've arrived, I think you'll agree it's a hidden treasure. It is a 10-minute walk from the train station, and within walking distance to Rome's center. There is shopping in the area, as well as many of the attractions. I will most definitely book the Lilium again if I return to Rome and would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: maren12
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice for a total of 6 weeks, including an extra week due to the volcano, and thoroughly enjoy it. The staff was incredibly friendly, accommodating, and helpful. The rooms were always clean (I stayed in the majority of them over my extended stay, from the tiny twin room (the "convent room"), to the lovely double rooms with balconies, to the spacious 3 person room) and the giant flower bouquet at the reception is a nice welcome. Location is great--10 min walk to Termini, Castro Pretorio (blue line), and Reppublica (red line) and 15 min walk to the sights...Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Barberini, Via Veneto, etc etc. Great restaurants all around and various markets and grocery stores nearby (helpful for the extended stay). Also laundry place very close. Overall, enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel for "S-Size" people”
Reviews.Author: Aldo051
Reviews.Content: Very clean, staff very friendly and kind, good position. Rooms are well equipped and recently refurbished, although limited in space. Breakfast is good in quality and quantity for a 3 star hotel, although the limited size of the breakfast room. A little noisy in the morning due to buses and to people walking on the corridor.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, the epitome of value, location, friendliness, and atmoshere!”
Reviews.Author: Mitch111
Reviews.Content: I'm rating this hotel so high, not because it's the most luxurious, or largest, or has the best location. I'm giving the Hotel Lilium my highest rating to date, because I loved it when we were there, and after a few months have passed, I still love it. When we first arrived, I was a little leery of the location, and the fact that we had to walk up a short flight of steps to get to the neat little elevator. However, Alessandro, who was a tremendous help, welcomed us warmly. He carried our very heavy luggage up the steps to the elevator, and the next thing we knew, our bags were in our room. Our room was small, but suited our needs just fine. It had a small bacony, and we took advantage of it many times. The bathroom was more than adequate. There was a wonderful Breakfast Room, and we got there early enough in the mornings to get a table with an outstanding view. Fresh squeezed orange juice and many cappuccinos accompanied our complimentary breakfast of meats, cheeses, and cereals. Not all the staff were fluent in English, but very friendly, and communication was not an issue. So, the room was clean (made up every day), the food was wonderful, the staff were friendly and attentive. Now, what was really neat was how close we were to so many sites. We could walk to nearly everything we wanted to see. There were a few times when we pushed our limits and opted to take a bus back. The bus stops just about right at the hotel, and even when we took the wrong bus once we only had to walk 2 blocks. There were 2 taxi rides, but they were suggested by our wonderful guide Francesca. We went to the Colosseum and to the Vatican by taxi, but when she departed, we walked back checking out all the details on our way. The location of Hotel Lilium ended up being excellent in this reviewers opinion. Over all, a great hotel for every reason I stated above.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally clean hotel, most helpful staff, free internet & breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: V8K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lilium Hotel in early November and were very pleased. This was possibly the cleanest hotel we have ever stayed in. From the front desk to the breakfast room, all of the staff were most friendly and helpful. The breakfast room was charming, with a generous cold breakfast buffet and delicious cappuccino. Free internet and loan of a laptop was most appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: AnzacSD
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in Mid August, Great hotel, Front desk was quite helpful at 1am when I needed to fax some documens back to the states, Room was good size with 2 single beds, and bathroom was quite large. Hotel Is not easily seen from the street, and have to walk up one flight of stairs before you get to the elevator, but its a great little place.

Reviews.Title: “A very satisfying experience”
Reviews.Author: TahoeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Liliumhotel We stayed at the Liliumhotel for 3 nights in June 2009 after a cruise. I don’t want to mislead anyone by providing too many good or bad opinions about this hotel, so I will just try to present the facts as best I can. We chose this hotel because my wife wanted to visit the Borghese museum and gardens and it was a short walk to that location. We also looked for a hotel that was in a price range that we would choose if traveling at home. We paid 133 Euros per night for the room. By American standards, that is probably about 50% higher than I would expect to pay for a hotel of similar quality at home. I have no idea whether the price was good or bad for Rome, but we did look at a number of places on the Internet and we read a lot of reviews before we chose this one. The neighborhood was convenient for restaurants and transportation. We were disappointed in the amount of graffiti on the walls of all the buildings in the area. It would appear that there are a lot of people here that have no pride. The hotel is on the third or fourth story of a large building and could be difficult to find. I don’t remember seeing the name of the hotel displayed anyplace on the front of the building. I printed out photos of the building that I found on the Internet so I could show them to the taxi drivers. They helped on several occasions when we hired taxis to return to the hotel. All you see from the street are two very large wooden doors with an arch above them. The name of the hotel is listed on a directory on the right side of the doors. Press the button and they will buzz open the doors. A few minutes after we pressed the bell, one of the desk clerks showed up to help us with our bags. We were happy for the help. The bags must be carried up one story to where the elevator starts. Then two trips were necessary to get the bags and us up to the hotel, as the elevator is very small. Once we arrived at the hotel lobby, we were very graciously checked into our room and the clerk again took our bags to our room and showed us how to use the controllers for the air conditioner, fan, and TV. The room also has a motorized blind that comes down on the outside of the patio doors to block off the sun on bright days in case one wants to nap during the day. He showed us the controls that were located behind one of the drapes on the right side of the glass doors. There was a lovely little balcony outside the doors with a small table and two chairs where two people could enjoy a drink surrounded by plants and flowers. The room was quite small by modern American standards. It appeared to actually be smaller than a typical cruise ship cabin. The bed was close to the floor, so it was not possible to put our bags underneath it. That caused the room to feel even smaller and congested. There was a fan over the bed and an air conditioner high up on the wall over the bathroom door. The TV was also mounted high on the wall to the left of the bathroom door. There was a refrigerator and a small vanity table, but the table had no mirror to assist women with their makeup. There was a small closet that was just adequate for our needs. Reading lamps and nightstands were on either side of the bed and the lights were adequate. There was also a light over the entry door and another one high above one corner of the room. The lighting was good. The bath was small, but had everything required except storage space for personal items. A very small shelf above the sink was all that was available for shaving gear, etc. The shower had a fiberglass enclosure with two sliding doors that both closed on a corner. They were somewhat difficult to open and close, but after working with them, the chore got easier. There appeared to be a towel warmer on one wall, but I was unable to figure out how it worked. Warm towels would have been a nice touch. They supplied soap, shampoo, etc. I did not understand why the soap was in the shape of a golf ball, but it seemed to do its job. Whenever we needed help or directions, there was always somebody available at the front desk to assist us and they always did so graciously. They have wireless laptops that can be borrowed for an hour at a time for Internet use and we did that on several occasions to send email home. They worked well. The hotel has a continental breakfast that is included in the price. I usually like a more substantial breakfast when I am traveling, but I was very impressed with the quality of the continental breakfast. I started with a sandwich made with a very fresh roll, sliced ham and Swiss cheese. It was no less than wonderful. With it I had the best pineapple juice that I have ever tasted and cappuccino coffee made to order. They had an enormous coffeemaker and the lady working in the breakfast room offered us about 6 kinds of brew including American coffee. The only drawback was that the cups were only about half full and several cups were required to get a normal American helping. She was always happy to brew up another cup for us. After finishing my breakfast sandwich, I discovered that they had croissants on another counter that I had not noticed before. I decided to try one and it was outstanding. I have never had one that good in my entire life. I filled it with Austrian Johannes berry jam that was one of about 10 different jams offered in small, individual jars. I followed that with another croissant with another kind of jam. It was heaven. Each day, I tried a different kind of jam. They were all excellent. My mouth is watering as I write this. The entire hotel was kept in spotless condition, especially the floors which were cleaned daily and gleamed. The birds in a corner of the breakfast area added a homey touch and the flower arrangement at the front desk was gorgeous. We felt that the owners of this hotel did everything they could to make our stay as comfortable and memorable as possible. When we were ready to leave we needed transportation to Fiumicino (near the airport) where we were going to spend our last night before flying home. Somewhere I had read that the hotel could arrange for a car and driver to take us there at a rate less costly and more comfortable than a taxi. The desk clerk made a call for us and we got a very nice car to take us to the other hotel. It took over an hour to get there and the total cost was 40 Euros. I had read that we could pay far more than this amount for the same ride, so considered this to be a bargain. We were extremely satisfied with our stay at this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel with good service.”
Reviews.Author: OntarioMinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Hotel Lilium. The hotel is clean--very clean!!. It is well maintained and the service was good. The staff were able to communicate in English with us, which made it easier for us. The breakfast each morning was very good.We would definitely stay there again and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem...”
Reviews.Author: imbsjs
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delightful hotel, 10 min walk from Stazione Termini, which is useful if you have an early flight. Rooms are spotlessly clean and extremely tastefully appointed. When I asked for a room awas from the street, they moved my things and upgraded me from my single room to a double room without charging me. There are a lot of personal touches like the soap in the shape of a golf ball. Sadly, I didn't have time to sample the breakfast as my flight was so early but the breakfast room looked charming.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING...NO WORDS”
Reviews.Author: mrshntaylor
Reviews.Content: We honestly felt out of place this hotel was sooo nice...we are middle class americans on a european tour and used to holdiay inns.... - this place is AWESOME and the same price as other hotels! this was our last stop before going home and we forgot to take pictures of the hotel - and this was the best place! the hard wood floors - gorgeous. the beds - clean, crisp, white, view from rooms - great - great location. nice staff - we showed up with one extra person - but they made arrangements for us! breakfast FREE and great - there is a person there to squeeze orange juice. birds in lobby - great! can't say enough. maybe a little hard to find - on the top of another building (small elvator for luggage and about 2 people)- but great place. great little restaurant around the corner with outside patio(they served us when they were closing). can't say enough. would go back in a second - hope i get to! bathrooms great - a/c great - bus stops rigt in front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel; Location Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Sara_Lime
Reviews.Content: This is a really clean, beautiful boutique hotel in a secure, charming building on a somewhat busy street near Termini railway station. The walls in the lobby are painted with a hand painted mural, and there is a pretty bird cage in the corner by a window that has an expansive view of the neighborhood. The ambiance is very soothing. The staff was very helpful; they will loan you a laptop if you want to check your email in your room. The room that I stayed in was small, but it had a pretty terrace and a very clean, modern bathroom. The location is okay if you want to stay near Termini, but it's a bit of a walk to the Spanish Steps and many of the other "Old Rome" sights, especially if you're coming home alone late at night on foot. I will be returning to Rome again this year, but will not stay at this hotel primarily because of the location, although also since I think it is a tad expensive for a single traveler.

Reviews.Title: “A find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KarsonD
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a piece of artwork. Lovely decor, immaculately clean, beautiful breakfast room. I enjoyed staying there and appreciated the beauty of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: BestMates
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old Daughter and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Lillium Hotel in Rome and we are delighted with our stay. The staff are excellent. Always on hand and ready to help in every way possible - including offering to prepare a simple supper for my daughter when she fell ill. The room was perfect. Nicely decorated and spacious with a lovely balcony. Both the air con and ceiling fan kept us perfectly cool in the heat. The bathroom was small but perfectly adequate and appointed with quality appliances. The reception area and breakfast room were havens of tranquillity after a hot day on the streets of Rome. I was given several excellent suggestions for restaurants and used the hotel laptop to secure my own arrangements for a day trip. (My daughter used the laptop to watch English language shows in bed !) On our last day, we were encouraged to use the shower before heading home - an excellent end to a great trip. Well done Lillium!

Reviews.Title: “Lilium is a gem”
Reviews.Author: Sean_MA
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome, and the Lilium turned out to be a great place to stay. The Lilium is a lovely botique hotel near the Porta Pia and Termini train station. My wife simply loved the place. Staff: The staff is exceptional. They gave great recommendations for places to eat, tours, and transportation. Everyone was friendly, courteous, and most importanlty, very helpful. My wife and I can not speak Italian, but English was not problem for the staff. Ammenities: This is a small botique hotel, so it does not have the services of a huge international chain. Room 35 is on the corner of the building on the quiet street side and only has one neighbor. We didn't have any noise problems at all and we enjoyed the balcony with table/chairs and ample flowers. Not all rooms have a balcony. The room was on the small side, but was tastefully appointed and spotlessly clean. The bed was very conformtable. There was a remote control air conditioning unit that was very powerful and very quiet (best I've seen). We are very picky about room temperature and we had complete control. The electronicly controlled window blinds could darken the room completely at any time of day. A very pleasant and highly unusual surprise was the availability of loaner laptops for internet access. I've stayed at scores of hotels and have never seen this done before. Breakfast: Breakfast was included and was quite pleasant. The fare included fresh squeezed orange juice - they squeeze the oranges on the spot. It was a nice continental style meal - nothing cooked or hot other than the fresh (and hot) coffee. Location: We arrived by train at Roma Termini and were able to walk to the hotel in about 10 minutes with our bags. The hotel is not clearly marked, but if you have a map and the address you will find it. There is a buzz in panel where you press a button to get the door (a HUGE wooden door) opened. The bus access was excellent. The 62 bus will take you right to St. Peter's. Like other reviewers, we took a walk to the Spanish Steps during the evening. In the blazing July sun, the air conditioned bus worked just fine for us. Security: We felt safe and secure at all times, both inside and out. Summary: The Lilium was a very pleasant and sweet place to stay - I would recommend this hotel to friends and family, and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sosjohn
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, very nice and helpful staff. We had a room with a terrace, which added a significant dimension to the place. Rooms are clean, perhaps a bit small, but larger than I have had in London. The hotel even offers laptop loaners, which came in handy as we hunted for Halal restaurants. Not sure why some reviewers have said the location is "off the beaten track" or a bit far from stuff, because the Lilium's location is perfect. Easily walkable to either Termini station (with bags) or the Repubblica station. One day we WALKED from the hotel to the Spanish Steps and on down to Trevi and the Coliseum. Right around the hotel you can stumble on great food everywhere. I take away one star from the overall because of one bizarre episode the morning of our departure. I left my bags in the lobby and ate a quick breakfast in the breakfast room adjoining the lobby. This was just after 7AM. After breakfast I find that my camera was taken from where it was laid on top of my bags. Nobody came thru the lobby that morning, mind you the hotel is behind a locked street door and 3 flights up. There is just NO foottraffic anywhere close. Only the croissant delivery guy came thru that morning, at exactly those minutes I was in the breakfast room. Clearly he boosted my camera. However the hotel staff refused to entertain that possibility. I was stupid to leave my stuff unattended perhaps. But you have to see this hotel to understand how secure I felt doing so. Ultimately I was not pleased with the lack of zeal on the part of the front desk staff to investigate. They just flat out said it was "impossible" that the bread dude took my camera. I would recommend this excellent hotel, but just take care as if you are staying at the Hilton in Tenderloin - er - that is, Union Square, SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: canadianman80
Reviews.Content: We found the Lilium on a last-minute booking website for a great price. It is a little out of the way from central Rome, but it was well worth the travel time. It was immaculately clean and cool, and the fresh flowers in the lobby made the air inside a welcome relief from the heat and pollution of Rome in the summer. The rooms were moderately furnished but comfortable and spacious as European hotels go. They were still renovating and couldn't provide us breakfast but instead they arranged for us to get free breakfasts at a delightful little cafe just a few doors away. What really impressed us was the friendly and helpful staff. En route from Paris a discount airline (I won't say which one) had lost my bag and they couldn't be reached to even issue a letter for insurance purposes - because they had no employees outside of England. The hotel concierge was amazingly helpful - he was on the phone for several hours calling the airports and airlines trying to help us find the bag (which was great because our Italian is not very good). He lent us a laptop so we could try to contact the airline over the internet. When we finally located the bag, he took delivery of it and held on to it for us all day even though we had already checked out. It is true that this is not a 5 star hotel - it is small and doesn't boast a lot of extra amenities. But if you are looking for the Hilton or the Sheraton... go stay there. If you want a great little boutique hotel that is a clean, comfortable, attractive alternative, stay at the Lilium.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel a little off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: chgo2016
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this "boutique" hotel for one night and ultimately switched because of the price. Bottom line, though...this beautiful hotel seemed more like a very clean, newly-renovated, gut-rehabbed apartment. Frederico, the primary desk manager, was absolutely great. We were able to walk to this hotel from the train station WITH bags in less than 10 minutes. While it is convenient relative to the train station, it is a little east of a lot of the major sights. There are two VERY convenient bus lines just across the street. One actually takes you directly to St. Peter's Basilica (The Vatican), all for 1 Euro. One unique and great bonus: they have laptops loners and free internet use..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Lilium”
Reviews.Author: Judgys
Reviews.Content: Booked the Lilium for a Wedding Anniversary break. Not the most romantic of hotels but very sweet. It took the driver over thirty minutes to find as the hotel is located on the third floor of a residential building and has no signs to direct you to it. It is located by a buzzer panel at the main door to the building. There is a delightful lift which takes you to reception and if you don't like lifts you can take the stairs but be prepared, there are quite a few. Check in was great and staff were exceptionally helpful as I regularly asked for tea or coffee as no facilities in the room, this was provided at no extra charge. The room was small but we had a beautiful terrace which was lovely, again bathrooms were also small but spotlessly clean. Breakfast was continental but lovely and beautifully presented. The lady who served breakfast was excellent also and nothing was too much trouble. Overall we loved our stay but the downside was that the hallways were laminate flooring and you could hear every person returning to their room or the doors locking, the echo was very loud. We could also hear our neighbours talking at night, not exactly the place to go for a passion filled weekend unless your not shy! Free laptop loan and internet access in the rooms was another perk so we could check in on line. I would recommend this hotel as it is located so centrally but beware the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a five minute walk (or a few minutes on the bus) from the Termini/bus station with a bus route into town a few minutes walk away from the hotel itself. The hotel is on the third floor with the superior rooms (with small balcony) facing onto a quiet courtyard, is very well decorated, modern and very clean with excellent fans and air conditioning. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly and the free use of internet for an hour is a nice bonus. The coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice served in the breakfast room are excellent. Although not situated in the heart of the main attractions, they are very easy to walk to or reach by public transport. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome and will certainly be staying here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dianamarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lilium while in Rome for our honeymoon and we couldn't have been happier there. The rooms were lovely with a nice bathroom, clean rooms, a balcony, and air conditioning. The staff were great, they helped us call the airport a few times to ask about our lost baggage. The breakfast was very good and everything was wonderful. I would definately stay there again. The only drawback is that the hotel is on the third floor, but there is an elevator for those who don't want to walk up a few flights of stairs. Overall, we loved the location of the hotel, the staff were professional and helpful, and the rooms were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure”
Reviews.Author: marcus2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a treasure. I was thinking of keeping it to myself but that would be unfair. My single room I stayed in was a little pokey (the only negative of my stay, but I glanced into one of the doubles and they looked very comfortable) but the facilities were excellent -safe, fridge with free bottled water, good shower, spotlessly clean, BBC world, free internet and use of a laptop to take to your room! The decor was lovely from the beautiful polished wooden floors to tasteful furniture. Breakfast was very good with freshly squeezed orange juice, lovely coffee, cheeses, meats, cereals etc. The breakfast room and other common room were beautiful - made you want to linger over breakfast and gaze over the bustling street below. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful and special mention must go to the lovely girl in the breakfast room. So sweet and so friendly - she put me in a happy mood every morning. Stay in this hotel - you'll not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hideaway in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Tonmi
Reviews.Content: Accomodations in Rome are difficult because more often than not you feel as though you've paid alot for nothing! The Lilium Hotel is a great little boutique hotel without the prices. We loved our stay there. It is very convienient to most all attractions and the train station. We were lugging backpacks so the being near to the station was a definite plus. The rooms are a little on the small side but unless you plan on spending your Roman vacation in a hotel room than no worries! We stayed there at the beginning of our two week trip and at the end. On our way to Naples we called the hotel to see if we could lighten our luggage load and they held some of our stuff until we returned three days later. Very helpful staff, ecclectic decor, good location, reasonable prices and a real off the beaten track feel make this a great place to spend a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Lilium”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Lilium Hotel on the basis of some good reviews. Sorry to disagree but we were disappointed. The hotel is on the third floor of a non descript building and if you don't like lifts, it is quite hike (and I am fit!). On the plus side, the hotel is beautifully clean and well kept. However, the rooms are minute, in a very cute style of a child's bedroom. The breakfast room is again very small but pleasant and the girl serving was lovely. The breakfast however consisted of cereal or rolls - they could have provided a little more althoughy orange juice and coffee great. There is no service whatsoever - we asked if it was possible for a cup of coffee at around 6.00pm and were told "it is not possible, the machine is turned off"! Even being in Rome, we thought it was very over-priced for the type of hotel and position.

Reviews.Title: “pity about size of rooms”
Reviews.Author: mppnicholls
Reviews.Content: breakfast room really pleasant, breakfast excellent, coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice beautiful. Hotel itself very clean, staff helpful but the major downside to all this was the size of the rooms - they are very small - also no wardrobe space at all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lillium Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous! A small boutique hotel with lots of character, gorgeous furnishings and is extremely clean. Guests can use a complimentary laptop for their room, and breakfast is simple but yummy! The coffee is delicious! Walking distance to the tourist attractions, shops and cafes (10-15 mins to most of them), or the bus stop is right outside. Found a great cheap restaurant on Via del Corso called 'Spizzico' or 'Autogrill'....much cheaper than the restaurants in the area. Would definitly recomend this hotel and will hopefully return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lilium in September and it was better than we were expecting! It was very clean, comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. As a 'tourist' class hotel, it was worth the money we paid for it. It was a short walk to most of the major tourist sites, but you were not right in the middle of all the hustle and bustle either, and there are some great wine bars and restaurants nearby that are off the beaten path and therefore not full of tourists, which was a pleasant change given how busy Rome is. The free laptop service they offer was really convenient as well. We would definitely stay there again.
